page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: The M1, opened in 1959 to join London and Leeds. It is a three lane motorway and its gradient has been made as smooth as possible by the use of embankments and cuttings. Junction 9 which links the A5 and M1 is also in th area and takes up 0.25 sq km. In 1985 this section of motorway is to undergo major repair which will involve its closure for two weeks and a considerable amount of disruption on local roads. The A5, Watling Street, is an old Roman road. It formed a main route from London to Holyhead. In 1979 it was declassified from being a trunk road renumbered the A5183, this was done by Hertfordshire County Council, to try to discourage heavy vehicles.
